review_text: 3.5 STARSFOOD: I love my sandwiches
column6: and Dilly's always satisfies me. The sandwiches are pretty big. I like the Smokey Mountain because any sandwich with bacon in it is twice as good as those without! I think you get a free cookie with your sandwich
column7: not sure though. PRICE: Around $7 for a sandwichATMOSPHERE: Nothing amazing
column8: but definitely good enough to sit down at.SKINNY: For those of you who love your sandwiches for lunch
column9: go to Dilly's Deli and you shouldn't be disappointed.

review_text: Poor knock off of the Persian Room down the way on Scottsdale Rd. I heard they even stole the menu and recipes although they don't seem able to follow the recipes very well. The food is a nice try but still something is missing. Don't waste your time the original is not far away go to the Persian Room instead
Ahh cheesesteaks
column6: what a sensitive topic. Well I feel that before I start I have to state that I AM a Philly native. I'm not saying my review/opinion holds more weight than that of others
column7: but basically
column8: it does. Forefather's is good to go in my book! I tried their the original and it did bring a slight smile to my face when I bit into it. The shredded style of steak isn't my choice (see my Steve's Prince of Steaks review) but other than that

review_text: Their current ad in Echo says they are open Sunday. Brought a group of friends
column6: drove 50 miles roundtrip
column7: to find a sign on the door saying they are not open on Sundays for the summer. Suggest their advertisements match their hours of operations.

review_text: Pleasant surprise. This place is alot bigger than it appears from the outside and the atomosphere is very inviting and comfortable. If felt that for the money the quality of food was above average the the service was excellent. I would recommend their special dinners that include the salad
column6: steak an potatoe - very good value.

review_text: Delicious Donuts! Great service. My new neighborhood donut shop. I'll be back for the #1 combo - two donuts & a coffee. Perfect.
This is truthfully the best sushi place in town! when your there dont forget to ask for the secret menu.....

I've been to Mando's about four more times since my review...not much has changed as far as the quality of their food goes.  The horchata continues to be great.  So are the crispy little tacos.  I haven't ventured too far out of the box
column6: pretty much sticking with tacos
column7: burritos
column8: and chimis.  Its just something about the heftines of the chimi that you can't help but smile about.  Service continues to be friendly.  Only thing I'd like to see is an update for the interior

column10: I'm sure.

review_text: Not bad for the first gay club i've been to out here in the desert. If you're a lady
column6: the queens take care of you here. Didn't seem to have to wait in line for the bathroom nor really wait for a drink at the bar no matter how crowded it was that night. It seems the cocktail servers walk around with tin buckets of jello shots

column8: non-Scottsdale drink pricing which was a ++. As soon as this spot hit max. capacity

review_text: I've been coming to Oaxaca for a couple of years.  Before the remodel it was little more than a greasy spoon with great mexican fare.  After the remodel
column6: I felt like I needed to dress up a little
column7: the place is so classy!Luckily the food is still great!  I ordered the chicken soup
column8: which was delicious
column9: albeit sort of cold.  Very savory though.  I would definitely order it again
column10: and next time a bigger bowl.Although we didn't sit there
column11: the new bar looks like it would offer a good time.  Lots of tvs and a welcoming atmosphere.  It might be a good place to watch a game or meet men watching a game. :)  The last time I was here though...it took 20 minutes to get our tab...on a very very slow Saturday afternoon.  We had to ask several times.  But I will definitely go back as the food is so darn good.

review_text: Do you want to go for a hike by yourself to just think? This is the place. Do you need to take the kids somewhere to run around? Come here. Want to show visitors how rocks look in AZ? They will love taking pictures. If you grew up here
column6: you know Papago Park by sight. Take time to explore it
column7: and tread lightly!

review_text: One of the cleanest libraries in the East Valley!Staff is very helpful
column6: even if you have to wait in a line. Many options available for patrons. Nice little book store in front to purchase books. Bathrooms are clean and well maintained. We love coming to this library!

review_text: I never thought it could be done - customer service so mediocre that it turns me against a building housing thousands of books! The only thing brick and mortar booksellers have over the net is SERVICE. Ok
column6: AND instant availability in hard copy but then again
column7: I can instantly download so who needs a hard copy. Well
column8: I do because I'm one of those types but I'd rather wait a month than give you a dime. Why?Dear Staff: When you scowl at me (if acknowledge me at all) and then answer the phone and go to look for that customer's item while I was waiting first
column9: why...I'm outta there. This has happened more than once. Also - Heaven help the person who tries to return anything here. I'll barely wish upon this one star that you get it together because this isn't the first time you've disappointed me. It's a far drive to my local book seller but I'm willing to go the distance - something every employee should consider doing for each customer - especially the one standing right in front of her.

review_text: We ordered our bed about a week before Christmas and were quoted a delivery time of 8 weeks. Our bed arrived the first week of May. Their sales rep failed to tell us they shut their factory down in China for a MONTH in January extending that 8 week quote an additional month. If we knew this at the time we placed the order in December
column6: we would have looked elsewhere. We were told this only after calling to check on the status of the bed around Feb/March-ish. We were told we could cancel the order if we were unhappy with the wait time. No discount or apology was extended to us. They did offer free delivery and set up
column7: which they then tried to pass off again on us when the bed finally arrived.We had to refer their sales person back to their email stating that they would cover this for the massive inconvenience they caused us. I love their furniture
column8: the quality of the bed is great but based on their service I would not recommend Parnian unless you don't mind sleeping on a mattress on the floor for 5 months.

review_text: Upon first impressions
column6: not that impressed. After a few minutes
column7: I'm in love. The bartneders qere amazing
column8: hooking it up with much needed shots and a free beer when he forgot to change the keg. The bartenders love to joke around and it seems like there are a lot of regulars. Always a good sign...I would give this place five stars if I had the food
column9: they have tomato soup. Alas
column10: I was out with the biggest tool in N Scottsdale and apparenty I didn't deserve a meal with this horrible date because I wanted to leave so I could watch It's Always Sunny. Best decision of my life!Also

review_text: One of my goals coming into Phoenix was to find a great
column6: local Mexican or Latin-influenced place for lunch one day. Mission accomplished.I got a two-taco combo with horchata. For one
column7: I picked up the apparently legendary carne asada
column8: and the other
column9: barbacoa. The combo comes with a side of rice and beans. I even got guac on the side
column10: and there was three more salsas coming with my meal. So maybe I did pay $12 for lunch
column11: but... holy cow.I knew I was in for a good time when I sampled the rice. It's wonderful with a bit of fresh cilantro and lime will do to a side dish. I turned my attention to the beans
column12: and they were also not overlooked; what's the secret ingredient? Bacon fat? Salt pork? Whatever it is
column13: I thoroughly enjoyed the beans.The horchata I got with my meal was excellent! They use more cinnamon than I'm used to
column14: but it wasn't hyper-sweet and was just what I needed on another 100 degree day.The tacos were fresh
column16: and perfect. I liked the barbacoa   since it had a nice flavor from the marinade
column17: but the carne asada was the star of this meal; not overcooked
column20: not any other slew of adjectives that come to mind when I think of bad beef. It was juicy
column23: and perfect.The sauces were wonderfully complimentary and I found myself wishing that I had chips as an excuse to eat up all the sauce (including the grilled green pepper / onion/ chile sauce that turned into a four-alarm in my mouth).I didn't get a chance to do dessert since I was filled to the brim with what I had already ordered. But I find myself really hoping I go back to try it.I can't speak for authentic Mexican food places
column24: since I haven't been to many (or to Mexico). But I can speak to the food served at Mesquite; it's a great bargain!

review_text: We just finished a 3-day weekend at the resort and I cannot say enough about the facility or the staff
column6: so I'll try to hit the highlights:The pool deck staff are outstanding.  They are friendly and fast.The pool and the hot tub are clean and both at the perfect temperatures.The food is phenomenal.  I highly recommend the bento boxes and all the salads.  I would also suggest selecting the asian inspired creations.  The only average selection we had was the kobe beef hot dog.  The spa is spotless and the staff is superb.  Both my fiancee and I reported to each other it was one of the top three messages we had ever had.  I would recommend asking for Tim C.The rooms are tastefully appointed and the bed
column7: sheets and towels are deluxe.I am already planning another trip to the Sanctuary.Enjoy!

review_text: We were told that this was a good place to go with our 2 kids.  We arrived at 5:45 on a saturday evening
column6: and they were slammed.  The service was slow
column7: I am pretty sure our waitress had WAY too many tables.  I got the bacon blue burger and it was good
column8: although they overcooked
column9: I asked for medium and it was well.  My husband liked his southwestern wrap
column10: until he picked up the second half and discovered a hair on the plate.  Once our waitress returned she immediately took it away and asked him if he wanted anything else
column11: but at that point he lost his appetite.  They did take the $ off the bill.  It took our waitress at least 10 minutes to bring the check once we asked for it
column12: then we paid partly with cash and partly with a card.  We instructed that she take the cash off the bill and put the rest on the card
column15: and full amount on the bill.  Now we stand around another 10 minutes waiting for her to return.  Finally get it all taken care of and get out of there. Definitely not someplace I would recommend or return to.  Maybe it is better during the week when they aren't as busy?

review_text: Another egg-citing way to start off a Monday Morning! Still on a Monday Morning
column6: this place does have a good amount of people. I was craving eggs benedict and ordered their Crab Eggs Benedict. I love this place; it still reminds me of Sunday brunch with the plaid table cloth. Their eggs benedict is large in size. But is it as delicious as the last time? Ah
column7: no it is not. After eating one of the best eggs benedict in New Orleans with real crab
column8: I now see this place as A-OK. It is still very cute and I like the environment. 3.5 stars!

review_text: I can't eat here anymore. The food is fine and the bagels are the best in town. The shit attitudes and poor service kill it. Fuck Chompie's!
Also a Marriott girl

column9: and attentive staff.

review_text: The food here is good
column6: pipping hot
column7: fresh
column8: and not over spiced or sauced. Location and food prices are great for all you ASU West Campus students
column9: so go take a walk off campus for a change and stop eating in that thing they call a cafeteria! Service and the staff here are great people
column10: make sure to tip handsomely because of this. Although the space to eat is minimal during lunchtime. Today
column11: a huge family decided to take up half of the restaurant
column12: which was very awkward for other patrons. I took my meal to-go today
column13: but sitting in normally isn't too bad. Its not much to look at

review_text: Any place where I can ride a slide to my table AND get to eat BBQ is already ahead of the game.  Great views of the city
column6: and an overall friendly staff
column7: and an overall enjoyable dining experience.

review_text: Tamales taste smokey and awesome.

I was looking forward to trying this place for a long time.  The reviews on Yelp were good and I was told by a fellow steak lover that if I wanted a great (not the best) cut of steak at a reasonable price
column6: then Texaz is the place to go.  I went on a Thursday evening and the place was pretty busy.  I was seated right away by a very friendly hostess.  You could tell from the looks of the place that it had been around a while.  I could have sworn my booth was going to fall apart
column7: but it was ok.  The d?cor is a bit eccentric with anything and everything having to do with Texas all over the walls.  All the patrons seemed to be having a good time and enjoying their meals.  There were also plenty of wait staff bustling around.While everything on the menu sounded delicious (but NOT diet friendly)
column8: I opted for the filet.  Next time I am going to order the prime rib or the chicken friend steak because I hear those are excellent.  My salad came quickly and was very good.  However
column9: it was a bit odd because it contained diced green olives (which I normally don't like)
column10: but I said what the heck and ate it all anyway.  I was pleasantly surprised.  When the steak arrived I was surprised again at the size.  I was expecting it to be much smaller but it was a pretty big cut.  I'm guessing around 8-10oz.  I love it when steaks are cooked in plenty of butter (gross to some people...I know) and I guess this place knew that because there was plenty of the hot
column11: melty goodness all over the steak and plate!  It was soooo good but soooo unhealthy.  It was cooked perfectly and I ate every bite.  The potatoes were just ok but I ate them anyway.  Nothing a bunch of salt and ketchup couldn't fix.  For dessert I ordered the homemade pecan pie and it was probably among the best I have ever had.If you are looking for an upscale steak/bbq joint then this is NOT the place for you.  If you are looking for place with some good meat with good prices and excellent service
column12: then this is the place for you.

review_text: Let's talk about the good things at Moto.1. Beer. The owner (who splits his time between CO and AZ) doesn't mess around with typical beers. You won't find Budweiser
The sauce for the Seafood Choo Chee was absolutely fabulous and I would return just to drink their Thai Tea again!

Bad Experience!!! I loved the selection of cars they had. I went there yesterday to test drive a lexus is250 used. I fell in love with the car and would of bought it right then and there. But the sales associate Easton McIntosh was terrible!!! If you ever go there please see another sales associate! I have never felt that belittled ever by someone.If your buying a car you should never feel like that. One
column6: its already a stressful situation buying a car. Second
column7: to have the sales associate talk you down and belittle you is so unprofessional. At one point he said to me and my dad; Why are you even here if you cant afford the car. HOW RUDE!!!! Tells you a lot about the company if they have people like that working for them. They were non negotiable. This is my first car and I had 50% cash down payment and he still wouldn't work with me. Ill find another car elsewhere and where they appreciate my business. To bad because I loved the car. If anyone on here knows of another sales associate at this dealership who is willing to work with you let me know

review_text: I came here after a grueling evening swim practice so I was really hungry - which means anything should taste really good
column6: right? I ordered the carne asada meal

column8: though
column9: was a disappointment. The beef was very dry and tasteless and the rice was dried out

column11: the meal was unsatisfying and I left quite a bit of the meal unfinished. I may try the place again some day as this may have been an off day for the restaurant

review_text: I cant believe this place has no reviews yet! The lady that helped me was very friendly and helpful. Im a huge fan of teavana but I will definitely be coming back here for a couple loose leaf teas that teavana doesnt have! They also have several types of tea already brewed for you to sample

review_text: service was friendly
column6: and prompt. Drinks were large and free refills

review_text: Don't let your initial reaction to the buildings in the front discourage you from enjoying Yoli's Cafe.  Hidden behind a house and in a quaint courtyard of other personalized mom and pop stores
column6: Yoli's is a gem in Chandler. Sitting outside we enjoyed large steaming cups of tea and coffee.  One of us enjoyed the Country Omelet while the other had the Garden Skillet with green chilies instead of the peppers.Great food
column7: great atmosphere
column8: great hostess! We were waited on by Yoli and another young lady who were attentive and very helpful.

review_text: This place was really
column6: really good. So good I would drive from Gilbert to go again. I had the prime rib and it was excellent! The dessert was also amazing.

review_text: corny spot
column6: but it's next to the hotel and Guiness is on the menu tonight

review_text: The location is kind of like a hidden gem type of sorts.  The main entrance is in the back atrium of the strip mall with good scenery of passerbys and neighboring restaurants.  I'm definately going to check this place out for the happy hour $5 glasses of vino and 1/.2 apps is a deal that can't be beat.  The food is pretty good and the presentation is pretty right on.  The feel of the restaurant initally is date night feel while lunch is more relaxed and laid back.  Nery has always been there to greet us and the support staff/server has been always very coridal.  I've only stopped in twice but I'll definately be back for more.  I've ordered the fish special both days and the balance for a light yet hearty dish has hit the spot everytime.  The homemade bread is AMAZING.  It is a biased opinion only because the bread smells
column6: tastes and presents like the bread I'd make with my grandmama.  Totally good stuff.  I'll be back again and again!

review_text: Big sandwiches.  Big.Bread is great on a good day and fair when they don't have it fresh.Mom loves the Philly cheese-steak.I like the Italian.  I always ask for hot peppers.Ordering and paying can be a bit confusing.  Best thing to do is to order and immediately go to the cash register to pay.  Otherwise you have your sandwich
column6: you're hungry and then you have to go pay.  I'm not sure how they dont get ripped off.  It would seem to me it would be easy to order

review_text: This is a favorite destination dining experience. The extensive gardens on the grounds and the pastoral picnic picuresque arboretum are worth the slightly expensive bakery treats and sandwiches.
I'm not usually a fan of chain restaurants
column6: even upscale ones like the Yard House. However
column7: I am a fan of the Yard House
column8: and here's why: First
column9: the beer selection; if you're a fan of craft beers like I am
column10: you will appreciate the dozens of craft beer offerings
column11: many of which I have never tried. The Bear Republic IPA was my favorite of the night. Second
column12: the menu is interesting and the food flavorful. I had egg rolls and lettuce wraps; both were in Asian-fusion style and wonderfully flavored. Third
column13: though some reviewers have complained about price
column14: for Monday Night Football they have all-night happy hour
column16: appetizers and pizza. You can order appetizers and eat Tapas style while you watch the game from a large number of big screens. With beers
column20: knowledgeable and quick. How many places have a waitress that can and will talk about the relative merits of craft beers
column22: give you just long enough to decide then come back to take your order?  Sandra

review_text: The teriyaki and arizona bowls are good!
I love this place. The crew is fun to chat with and pick on just a little. The foods are wonderful
column6: and how can you not love a place with a case of beautiful

review_text: I have been raised on deep dish pizza since I was a child so I am a huge deep dish pizza fan. When I read about Little Sicily's deep dish on Yelp
column6: I had to try it. It's not bad. I had a take-out order. The girl who answered the phone told me 15 minutes
column7: but when I arrived it took another 15 min or so for it to be ready
column8: which is around the time a normal deep dish usually takes to make. They may have pulled my large sausage and mushroom pan (deep dish) pizza a little early because the crust was chewy and a bit doughy so I put it in my oven for a few minutes
column9: then the crust seemed to be cooked properly.I didn't like the massive amount of garlic in the sauce. I love garlic
column10: but it was way too much. If I didn't know any better
column11: I thought they were trying to help us drive out all the vampires in Surprise. Also
column12: I didn't care for the mushrooms. The mushrooms didn't seem fresh. They tasted like mushrooms out of a can.Overall
column13: the large sausage and mushroom pan pizza was ok. When we get in the mood for deep dish
column14: we will be back. When I took my first bite using a fork and knife (like a good deep dish is always eaten)

review_text: Have a hankering to eat meat from sticks and don't want to visit the county fair? Thai Rama is your place.Of course I am speaking of the chicken satay. Very good with some peanut sauce. I haven't had a whole lot of exposure to Thai restaurants but the few times I have been here
column6: I haven't been disappointed.The menu offers many interesting dishes including a soup served in a flaming bundt cake pan (OK so it isn't actually a bundt cake pan
column7: but  I like to imagine it is). The soup is absolutely delicious
column8: just don't eat the wood floating in it. For seasoning only. You can eat it if you want
column9: just don't come crying to me when you have a mouth full of splinters. I tried a coconut curry stew with chicken and potatoes. I couldn't stop eating it even after I was full. An incredible dish available in varying degrees of spiciness.Might I also suggest you try an iced coffee? I'd have it with or for dessert though. It's so sweet and strong and good that I swore I could almost see through walls when I finished it.The staff is very friendly and attentive and I would recommend Thai Rama to anyone. Even you... I guess.

review_text: The best Pho in the valley!!! And there may be better Pho out there  but I have not had it so as far as I an concerned it's the best Pho on the planet!!! And the spring roles are good too! :)
Soooo disappointing! I've been to this one and one in Tucson
column6: same story! Over priced buckets. The crab legs are thin and flimsy. My veggies and potatoes were over salted with chunks of sea salt!! Yuck!

review_text: Not impressed.  Service was slow

column9: the food was great.  Coincidentally

review_text: We stayed at the Firesky Resort over 4th of July weekend...and we were not disapointed! We brought our 2 dogs (our main reason for staying at this hotel) and we were more than surprised to learn that your dog is allowed anywhere on the resort
column6: except for in the pool! The grounds are gorgeous...the pools are refreshing & the drinks are strong! They put anyone with dogs in a reserved wing of the hotel
column7: and it was funny to see so many dogs in one place! They host a daily wine reception in the lobby
column8: where they invited us to bring our dogs to (and we did!) It was nice to stay in a resort where our entire family felt welcome. I will definitely be returning to the Firesky!

review_text: Only thing keeping this place from 5 stars is a few nitpicks about my meal.  It was good though and I will go again.  But read on.*Service:  TOP NOTCH!!  From the moment I walked in the door the girl that noticed me walk in jumped up and came on over..gave me a couple options of where I wanted to sit
column6: I chose to sit at the bar.  They set me up with a tasty sweet tea right away.  Delicious it was.  My waitress was attentively awaiting my order

review_text: Sweet Republic makes the best ice cream in America
column6: as far as I'm concerned. I've been to the place several times and I have never had anything which was less than amazing. Everything is made in the store
column7: from ice cream to sorbet to cookies and waffle cones.Both of the owners are wonderful people who clearly have a passion for making and sharing great ice cream. They also use as many local ingredients as possible. Recently
column8: I've enjoyed Peaches & Cream ice cream made with fresh peaches from a local farm.Also
column9: Sweet Republic as come up with some flavors which one wouldn't think to put into ice cream
column10: but at this place
column11: different is magic. Jalapeno Avocado
column12: Bacon and Guinness are all flavors I've had here.But
column13: Sweet Republic also brings the magic to common flavors and does them brilliantly. Their Belgian Chocolate is to die for if you're a chocolate lover and their Mocha sorbet is fantastic. Finally
column14: the pinnacle of Sweet Republic's flavors is the Salted Butter Caramel. A true description of the taste of this ice cream is really impossible

review_text: I usually don't review chain restaurants since I don't want everyone to know that I eat at them...but I have to give a shout to this location of McCormick's!  We were in Phoenix for a quick weekend and I had neglected to do any Yelp research before leaving
column6: so when my bf found M&S from the concierge we decided to give it a go.  We had been disappointed with our last experience at the one in Dallas so I was mainly just hoping to have my hunger satiated so I could go to bed.I was very pleasantly surprised.  We were hungry so ordered what felt like tons of food (don't judge!).  The mussels and bruschetta to start were great!  The mussels were small
column7: the way I like them
column8: and the sauce/broth/bread soak they were in was amazing.  I had the halibut stuffed with a bunch of stuff as suggested by our server
column9: bf had the dover sole
column10: both were good
column11: but that dover sole was amazing!!!!  very light and perfectly cooked.  I wish I could cook fish like that.We finished with some kind of passionfruit mousse dessert that was SO good.  I almost took another one to go.The service was great.  I would go back to this M&S location anytime I was in town.

review_text: if you're into heavy
column6: rich food

column9: if i do say so myself.honestly

review_text: POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE:I have been a long term customer --- Always a cheese or sausage and two pieces of  cheese cake and chicken wings. Last night my wife wanted KFC - so I went there and got her meal - I called Mamma Mia from KFC and said I would like two slices and a cheese cake ---- the girl said we don't take orders for slices over the phone. Are you kidding? She said it was a rule and it had something to do with being ready for walk in customers. I said I am a customer. I explained that I had my wife's food with me and I did not want to wait for the slices as sometimes it is not that quick and I didn't want her food to get cold. She then gave me another girl - who said the same thing - the manager Chris was out. I asked her to have him call me. No call back - and I called back twice for him and he was always out. I cannot believe that they would be so customer unfriendly and cannot believe they have some silly rule about not being able to order slices over the phone - I guess that includes cheese cake. That is ok ---- I went to Spinatos which is much better. Mama Mia has lost my business of the last ten years ------ I am out of there.CHRIS MAYBE YOU SHOULD RETURN A CUSTOMERS CALL - THE OWNER SHOULD FIRE YOU. MAYBE YOU DONT KNOW WHO I AM.
I saw the name Hyatt
column6: then I saw the price of $75 after taxes and fees
column7: and something just didn't add up. We check in and the front desk attendant was extremely courteous and helpful. We walk into our room and are simply amazed. You will have a hard time finding a better hotel for the price of this one. Large room
column8: very sheik trendy decor. the sofa in the living room looked like something out of a trendy art deco store
column9: not something that would normally contain a sofa bed! the kitchen area was a bonus
column10: and dining/desk was great. The 50 LCD TV was amazing

review_text: I really love this studio! A few months ago
column6: I purchased a Living Social deal that covered 20 classes in a three month period. This new studio is located in a small strip mall at the corner of Osborn and 7th Ave
column7: a few doors down from the video rental store. I live in the Park Central neighborhood and it takes me 5 minutes to walk over. The studio itself is small but decorated in a way that makes it seem intimate. Very

column7: and I'm 29. Fuck them and their straight bartenders. Won't be going back.

review_text: I like to come here for lunch dinner and every now and then i will go over there for.late nite fun!!!! Its the best thing to happen to quiet arcadia...lol...its nice to have a late night lounge in the area because there is really only scottsdale for night life...its not too crazy but its a good time...decent drinks its just very small...i like the outdoor area in the back! I hope this place stays for a longtime because it has truly be come apart of the arcadia scene...the food is pretty good too...their sweet potato fries are delicious omg!!! Their burger is pretty good too...i really enjoy the ambiance and the staff is very nice and friendly...its nice that they have valet because the parking is impossible hahaha...i truly enjoy this place its fun to go with friends and.great to have a nice lunch during the work week.  I love the deal on mondays...a burger and fries for $5 thats pretty d##n good...you should try this fun place...
Hands down the best neighborhood Italian restaurant in AZ. The veal
column6: chicken and pasta dishes are all amazing. One of the best salads in town as well. The bar menu is one of the best deals as well
column7: tons of food for not a lot of money. They also pour a great glass of wine.

review_text: I still like this place... this being the 5th time I've come here.  I wrote this update as this was the first time I actually tried something that wasn't the Vintage Burger or the Charcuterie Board and wanted to share my opinions:- Warm Brie: ok portion of cheese
column6: though hummus was meager and I think the grilled vegetables could've been more grilled and grilled-looking (as in grill marks

review_text: The one thing keeping me going when I drove across the country to San Diego was knowledge that I had 1st row behind home plate tickets for the Padres spring training game.  For my first trip to Spring Training
column6: I had an awesome time at the Peoria Sports Complex.  It was super easy to get great seats
column7: and my 1st row ticket only cost $28.  Not bad for living the life of luxury sitting next to the Padres brass.  I particularly enjoyed watching Omar Minaya have to consult the media guide to read the bio on each Padres prospect that took the mound or came up to bat.  Good to know our highly compensated club VP is really on the ball.  The stadium had a decent selection of craft beers
column8: but I had to walk to the outfield to get it.  When you are sitting in King's seats behind plate
column9: you don't want to trudge out to the outfield with the plebians to get a Fat Tire Dig
column10: but sometimes you have to swallow your pride for a quaffable oat soda.  A real bonus of coming to Peoria was the In N Out literally two blocks outside of the parking lot exit.  A real anti bonus is that things in Phoenix are way further apart than they look on Google Maps.  It took me 35 minutes to get to Peoria from the Scottsdale W I was staying at.  Oh well
column11: Padres spring training was worth it
column12: even if they lost.

review_text: I must be dreaming
column6: 'cause this place is just too cool. Tucked in side an easy to miss house with a barely noticeable sign even during the day
column7: find yourself sipping down a bottle of your favorite libation or have them pour you a locally brewed craft right out of their ice cold taps. Like many of the stops along Roosevelt in Downtown
column8: The Roosevelt elevates the cool of the area by a factor of ten.After having one too many and falling into a happy stupor
column9: I slipped back tipping myself off the edge of the seat. I must have gotten quite the knock on the head. Waking up dazed
column10: confused
column11: and aimlessly wandering about Roosevelt Row in downtown. That must have just been a weird dream I am awaking from. How on earth did I arrive here? and why am I so hungry? I wondered. Good thing the Roosevelt is just down the way

review_text: Hard to find real Italian food in Arizona.  Let's face it everyone can claim it
column6: but hard to match NY style Italian.  Brio
column7: being a chain itself
column8: rises above the other chains and offers some higher quality Italian cooking.My wife always gets the whole roasted chicken which *is* really good.  It's some of the best restaurant chicken I've had.I'm partial to trying something different each time I come here
column9: sticking with some pasta dish (heck I can get a steak somehwere else).  The ala Vodka dishes are great and anything with prosciutto is tasty.This is a great place for small-ish date night group of friends.  Service is always good for us
column10: selection is consistent with specials when you want them and the quality of the food has been excellent for me each time.Tip: check out the happy hour times to save some cash :-)
